references.paper_title: Retrieval-augmented generation for knowledge-intensive nlp tasks
references.reason: This paper is crucial because it introduces the concept of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), which is central to the CoRAG framework.

references.paper_title: Communication-efficient learning of deep networks from decentralized data
references.reason: This paper is foundational as it presents the Federated Averaging (FedAvg) algorithm, a key method used for collaborative training in the CoRAG framework.

references.paper_title: Leveraging passage retrieval with generative models for open domain question answering
references.reason: This paper highlights the importance of leveraging passage retrieval for open-domain question answering, a principle extended in the current work to collaborative settings.

references.paper_title: Natural questions: A benchmark for question answering research
references.reason: This paper is significant as it describes the NaturalQuestions dataset, which is used to construct the CRAB benchmark for evaluating the CoRAG framework.
This paper details the Flan-T5 model, which is used as a baseline model in the experiments and is also compared with the proposed CoRAG framework.
